definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
tui na (form of Chinese manual therapy)

sentences.chinese: 拿睡眠剥夺来举个例子。

sentences.english: Yes, I would like to help you carry these bags.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我愿意帮你拿一下这些包。

sentences.english: Let me send you our catalog in English.
sentences.chinese: 请拿一本图书目录给我看看。

sentences.english: But she did not tell her husband Nabal.
sentences.chinese: 这事她却没有告诉丈夫拿八。

sentences.english: Suppose I hold up a photograph of a beach with nobody on it.
sentences.chinese: 假设我拿着一张画着无人海滩的图片。

sentences.english: Can I get you your drink while you are making your selection?
sentences.chinese: 在您点餐的时候，我可以帮你拿杯饮料吗？

sentences.english: Suddenly the hero's son picked up a knife and killed the dragon.
sentences.chinese: 突然英雄的儿子拿起刀杀了龙。

sentences.english: Well read it, and we'll talk about it some other time, eh.
sentences.chinese: 那好，拿去看吧。我们另找时间谈，嗯？

sentences.english: Continue to hold the thermometer in place while taking his temperature.
sentences.chinese: 量体温的过程中要一直拿住体温计。

sentences.english: The lady beaned me with her umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 那位女士拿伞敲我的脑袋。

sentences.english: The man took it and asked what he had to pay his shave.
sentences.chinese: 卖扫帚的人拿回了扫帚，随后问修面要付多少钱。

sentences.english: When I take a shower, he grabs a magazine and sits on the toilet, reading.
sentences.chinese: 我洗澡时他拿了本杂志进来坐在马桶上念。

sentences.english: My friend Tao Jun likes fish and vegetables very much.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友陶军拿非常喜欢鱼和蔬菜。

sentences.english: After, at together while just wanting to elected up a cosmetics to make up for farmland dream Jean Jean.
sentences.chinese: 之后，在齐珍珍刚要拿起化妆品帮田梦化妆的时候。

sentences.english: He put his possessions up for auction.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的财产拿出来拍卖。

sentences.english: After going only a mile or so, they realized they had forgotten the milking stools.
sentences.chinese: 走了大约一英里，他们发现挤奶用的凳子忘记拿了。

definition: to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
in hand/(a situation is) in sb's hands

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to take possession of/to get hold of
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
